trans-unit.source: Represents a collection of <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridTableStyle"></xref> objects in the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGrid"></xref> control.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.GridTableStylesCollection> contains <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridTableStyle> objects that allows the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGrid> control to display a customized grid style for each <xref:System.Data.DataTable> in a <xref:System.Data.DataSet>.
On the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGrid> control, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGrid.TableStyles%2A> property returns the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.GridTableStylesCollection>.
By default, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.GridTableStylesCollection> does not contain any <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridTableStyle> objects.
Instead, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGrid> displays each table using default settings for color, width, and formatting.
All columns of each table are displayed.

When a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridTableStyle> is added to the collection, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGrid> uses the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridTableStyle.MappingName%2A> to determine which object supplies the data for the grid.

For example, if the data source is a <xref:System.Data.DataSet> that contains three <xref:System.Data.DataTable> objects, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridTableStyle.MappingName%2A> must match the <xref:System.Data.DataTable.TableName%2A> of one of the objects.

If the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridTableStyle.MappingName%2A> does not match any of the <xref:System.Data.DataTable.TableName%2A> values, the default settings will be used to display data for each table, and the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridTableStyle> settings will be ignored.

Always create <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridColumnStyle> objects and add them to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.GridColumnStylesCollection> before adding <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridTableStyle> objects to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.GridTableStylesCollection>.

When you add an empty <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridTableStyle> with a valid <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridTableStyle.MappingName%2A> value to the collection, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridColumnStyle> objects are automatically generated for you.

Consequently, an exception will be thrown if you try to add new <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridColumnStyle> objects with duplicate <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridTableStyle.MappingName%2A> values to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.GridColumnStylesCollection>.
Alternatively, clear the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.GridColumnStylesCollection> using the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.GridColumnStylesCollection.Clear%2A> method.
Adds a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridTableStyle"></xref> to this collection.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridTableStyle"></xref> to add to the collection.
The index of the newly added object.
Adds an array of table styles to the collection.
An array of <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridTableStyle"></xref> objects.
Clears the collection.
Occurs when the collection has changed.
For more information about handling events, see [Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f).
Gets a value indicating whether the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.GridTableStylesCollection"></xref> contains the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridTableStyle"></xref> specified by name.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridTableStyle.MappingName"></xref> of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridTableStyle"></xref> to look for.
`true` if the specified table style exists in the collection; otherwise, `false`.
Gets a value indicating whether the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.GridTableStylesCollection"></xref> contains the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridTableStyle"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridTableStyle"></xref> to look for.
`true` if the specified table style exists in the collection; otherwise, `false`.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridTableStyle"></xref> specified by index.
Use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.GridTableStylesCollection.Add%2A> or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.GridTableStylesCollection.AddRange%2A> method to add items to the collection.
The index of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridTableStyle"></xref> to get.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridTableStyle"></xref> at the specified index.
No item exists at the specified index.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridTableStyle"></xref> with the specified name.

When retrieving a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridTableStyle> by <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridTableStyle.MappingName%2A>, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.GridTableStylesCollection.Item%2A> property uses a case-insensitive comparison.
Use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.GridTableStylesCollection.Add%2A> or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.GridTableStylesCollection.AddRange%2A> method to add items to the collection.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridTableStyle.MappingName"></xref> of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridTableStyle"></xref> to retrieve.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridTableStyle"></xref> with the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridTableStyle.MappingName"></xref>.
Gets the underlying list.
An <xref href="System.Collections.ArrayList"></xref> that contains the table data.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.GridTableStylesCollection.CollectionChanged"></xref> event.
A <xref href="System.ComponentModel.CollectionChangeEventArgs"></xref> containing the event data.
Removes the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridTableStyle"></xref>.

Use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.GridTableStylesCollection.Contains%2A> method to determine if a specific <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridTableStyle> exists before using the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.GridTableStylesCollection.Remove%2A> method.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridTableStyle"></xref> to remove.
Removes a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridTableStyle"></xref> at the specified index.

Use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.GridTableStylesCollection.Contains%2A> method to determine if a specific <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridTableStyle> exists before using the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.GridTableStylesCollection.Remove%2A> method.
The index of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridTableStyle"></xref> to remove.
Copies the collection to a compatible one-dimensional <xref href="System.Array"></xref>, starting at the specified index of the target array.
The one-dimensional <xref href="System.Array"></xref> that is the destination of the elements copied from the collection.
The array must have zero-based indexing.
The zero-based index in the array at which copying begins.
array is null.
index is less than zero.
array is multidimensional.
-or-
The number of elements in the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.GridTableStylesCollection"></xref> is greater than the available space from index to the end of the destination array.
The type in the collection cannot be cast automatically to the type of the destination array.
Gets the number of items in the collection.
The number of items contained in the collection.
Gets a value indicating whether access to the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.GridTableStylesCollection"></xref> is synchronized (thread safe).
`false` in all cases.
Gets an object that can be used to synchronize access to the collection.
The <xref href="System.Object"></xref> used to synchronize access to the collection.
Returns an enumerator for the collection.
An <xref href="System.Collections.IEnumerator"></xref> for the collection.
Adds a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridTableStyle"></xref> to this collection.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridTableStyle"></xref> to add to the collection.
The index of the newly added object.
value cannot be cast to a .
value has already been assigned to a .
-or-
A in has the same property value as value.
Clears the collection.
Determines whether an element is in the collection.
The object to locate in the collection.
The value can be `null`.
`true` if value is found in the collection; otherwise, `false`.
Returns the zero-based index of the first occurrence of the specified object in the collection.
The object to locate in the collection.
The value can be `null`.
The zero-based index of the first occurrence of value within the entire collection, if found; otherwise, -1.
Implements the <xref href="System.Collections.IList.Insert(System.Int32,System.Object)"></xref> method.
Always throws <xref href="System.NotSupportedException"></xref>.
You cannot insert an item into the middle of the collection.
Use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.GridTableStylesCollection.Add%2A> method to add a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridColumnStyle> to the collection.
The zero-based index at which value should be inserted.
The object to insert into the collection.
Always thrown.
Gets a value indicating whether the collection has a fixed size.
`false` in all cases.
Gets a value indicating whether the collection is read-only.
`false` in all cases.
Gets or sets the element at the specified index.
The zero-based index of the element.
The element at the specified index.
The item property cannot be set.
Removes the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridTableStyle"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridTableStyle"></xref> to remove from the collection.
value cannot be cast to a .
Removes the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridColumnStyle"></xref> with the specified index from the collection.
The zero-based index of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridTableStyle"></xref> to remove.
